definition: to patrol/to make one's rounds/classifier for rounds of drinks

sentences.english: The Indian patrol suffered 25 casualties, and the Chinese 33.
sentences.chinese: 印度巡逻队的伤亡人数是25，而中国伤亡了33人。

sentences.english: Border Patrol Special Response Team searches a hotel room-by-room in New Orleans in response to Hurricane Katrina.
sentences.chinese: 边境特别反映巡逻队逐屋搜索新奥尔良的一家旅馆。

sentences.english: Our patrol on all our fronts contacted no enemy today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我方在各条战线上的巡逻队均未遭遇敌人。

sentences.english: A naval patrol was sent to reconnoitre the approaches to the bay.
sentences.chinese: 一支海军巡逻队奉命侦察进入海湾的路线。

sentences.english: A man asked. I'm with the Afton Alps Ski Patrol.
sentences.chinese: 一个男的问，我跟阿夫顿阿尔卑斯滑雪巡逻队在一起。

sentences.english: Our patrols on all our fronts contacted no enemy today.
sentences.chinese: 今天我方在各条战线上的巡逻队均未遭遇敌人。

sentences.english: That which was directed at Jean Valjean at that moment, was the lantern of the patrol of the right bank.
sentences.chinese: 此时照着冉阿让的，是河右岸的巡逻队的灯笼。

sentences.english: One of the patrols discovered an arms cache.
sentences.chinese: 巡逻队中有一人发现了一批武器的藏匿之处。

sentences.english: He sent out scouts as well, to make certain no enemy took them unawares.
sentences.chinese: 他还派出了巡逻队，以确保没有敌人能偷袭他们。

sentences.english: You play as an American patrol which has to go into Vietnamese villages looking for Vietcong sympathisers.
sentences.chinese: 你扮演美军巡逻队，要深入丛林里寻找越共通敌者。

sentences.english: As they neared the grape hut, the patrol waded through an irrigation ditch.
sentences.chinese: 巡逻队涉过灌溉水渠，走近葡萄园小屋。

sentences.english: Then, add random patrols inside the walls to verify people's identity.
sentences.chinese: 然后在墙内添加随机巡逻队，以验证人员的身份。

definition: variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
SS or Schutzstaffel, paramilitary organization in Nazi Germany
to investigate a crime/to scout/to reconnoiter/reconnaissance/detection/a scout
